Hello, I‚Äôm Zinzy, and I‚Äôve been yelling at Internet clouds since the mid 90s

Welcome to my personal website. Consider this a quiet street on the Internet; a place for soft stances, lived experiences, and critical notes on the things I hold dear. This website is very much a personal endeavor. You‚Äôll find that I talk as freely about career challenges as I do personal struggles. I‚Äôm an advocate of the IndieWeb, which is to say I love an Internet that is transparent, intimate, and human-centered. If this sounds good to you, you should visit the IndieWeb wiki.

I live, laugh, love, and work in Amsterdam

Together with the absolutely dynamite Anja Waleson I share a shoebox in Amsterdam‚Äôs finest neighborhood, de Indische Buurt. We‚Äôre companions to corgi puppy Lemonade, who may or may not have her own blog (let‚Äôs find out together). I hate dogs. I don‚Äôt know how I got here. I enjoy writing, making music, and painting. I practice the love language of home cooking. I‚Äôm a swimmer, a cyclist, a cinephile, an urbanite, and a beginning embroiderer.

I‚Äôm a product researcher and designer with 17 years of experience

In May of this year I joined the team at Gerimedica, a healthcare technology provider in Amsterdam. Before that I was at Leeruniek, and before that at Airtrade. I originally cut my teeth running my own design and development practice, Studio Zinzy. What I love about design is that it‚Äôs a way of looking at the world rather than a skillset involving particular visual design tools. For the past eight years I‚Äôve been specialized in building tools for people at work.
